text:
Love the food at the Lodge, but they have one bartender I cannot stand. Yvette walked by me 5 times with an empty beer glass and didn't even ask if I wanted another.

The next time I needed a beer, she was at the other end of the bar messing around on her phone.

All of the other staff here are excellent, however, and their hamburgers are top notch.

I ate here twice on my trip to Las Vegas last weekend and enjoyed my meal both times. My uncle is a local and he goes here a lot. It was a very casual environment with lots of wood furniture and a few TV's (I'm not a fan of TV's in a dining area, but my uncle appreciated it so he could catch the end of a game he was into.) The service was excellent. Of course, they knew my uncle was a regular so that probably factored in, but none the less, our server was lovey both times and she appeared to be just as friendly to other people eating there. 

The food was really good. I had the pastrami reuben the first time I  ate there, and the french dip on my second visit. Both were excellent. The pastrami didn't have too much tough connective tissue that some pastrami can have (like subway's for example...yuk). It was very meaty and flavorful. The bread was fresh and I had my sandwich with a side of fruit (it was mixed fresh cantaloupe and canned tropical fruit). 

The reuben was also very tasty and a good size. We split a piece of fresh carrot cake and the frosting was amazing! I make Alton Brown's carrot cake from scratch, which is very good, but this frosting even rivaled that recipe! 

I went back to buy a gift certificate for my uncle as a thank you for letting me crash at his place and the bar tender informed me that they had to call the owner? manager? to come in to get  it because the staff were "not authorized to sign for it". That was a little inconvenient, but it wasn't a terribly long wait and the bar tender was super friendly. She offered me a cold soda/water while I waited and checked on me a couple times. 

Overall, I thought the food was delicious and the people there were very nice. I recommend The Lodge if you are looking for a tasty, not too pricey bite to eat in a casual setting.

Not a bad spot in the northwest corner. Bartenders seem to talk to other employees and regulars more often then not. They talk about other coworkers instead of tending to guests. Food is decent. I wish they would take care of the problem people that come in faster as well. Young drinkers that just want to screen and cause a scene should be kicked out asap.

The food service is poor, the bar service is not much better.  I've tried this place several times and normally I leave thinking why do I come here. I guess it was location but now I go across the street!

I would give this place three stars, but...

Top 5 reasons for one star:

V) The atmosphere is sooo typical of what you can expect inside LV stand alone bars.
IV) Drunk chimney women sitting next to me telling her friends that blacks are ruining the USA. (Hey! I'm right here next to you!)
III) Teeny tiny pours.
II) Best looking bartender left as soon as I got there.
I) Permanently lost ten I.Q. points when I left.

Waitress Deena is oblivious to her customers, takes her sweet time with everything she does, and forgets half of what you ask her for. I'm usually pretty satisfied when I go there, but we have had her as our waitress 3 or 4 times and each time I am more dissatisfied. To the point where I may not go there anymore.
Simple menu moderately priced but for the price and excellent value

Typical local bar: bartenders ignore you if you're not regular, cigarette smoke all over the place. If you wanna breathe go outside. Everybody is watching big screens, no socializing. But that's not the reason for 2 stars. The kitchen is terrible. The food is mediocre at best and the server for the restaurant simply can't handle more than 2 tables. She should be fired and the restaurant would gain an extra star. I live around the corner but never go there. Sad.

This place is okay. Servers are often complaining about how they work so hard and get minimum wage. Food is pretty good as long as they bring out the right food. Beer selection isnt that great. Great bar setup though.

Love this place! The food is awesome. Homemade chicken fried steak, good bacon, fresh breakfast potatoes, homemade ranch. Good coffee. Friendly servers. Clean place. Been here two days in a row and have had a great experience both times. The bartender Jennifer is super awesome. She makes a mean Bloody Mary. Great selection on beer on tap. Bar room is open and love the dim lighting. We will back back every day of our vacation!
food not very good and the service is bad the bartender was on the phone most the time and overall the place was kinda creepy

So I invited my friend to this bar near my house. We sat down at a table near the pool tables. The waitress comes over to take our drink order. I ordered a Moscow Mule and he ordered bourbon on the rocks. She said they had no bourbon and starts naming whiskeys instead, he ended up with a Glenlivet on the rocks. We ate and had several drinks, and then asked for our tab. Just to discover that we were charged $6 for rocks (ice) two cups of ice to be exact! We asked the waitress since when has ice become an extra charge at $3 dollars a cup? The waitress explained that it takes a bit more than a normal shot due to the rocks. WTF!!! We've been in this industries most of our lives and have never encountered this one. They should of at least first asked us if it was ok.
I never have a bad meal here & the service is the best. Ask for Jane when you are in the dining room, she rocks!
Love this place! Everything I get is great. Everyone is friendly, helpful and full of fun.

Prices are far above anything any sane person would call reasonable. Staff has a bad attitude and attempts to pad tips by charging you for free pool. Do not recommended this place. Food tastes good but way to expensive.

The wife and I went there for lunch today with our children, the food was great, service was fantastic The waitress there made sure we were taken care of and the babies were comfortable.
I'm not sure of our waitress name but she worked on November 17th which is Thursday at 12 o'clock p.m. thank you so much

WOW...HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE (MANAGER - KERRY)
First time customer with my sister.  Being the sober one...I received the bill.  After reviewing it and paying for all the drinks, I told the manager I just wanted him to be aware of the situation.  After I told him that we were over charged but NOT to worry...his response was..."my waitress did not just randonly add an additional drink, BUTTTT next visit let me get you a free drink, IT WILL MAKE ME FEEL BETTER".
I NEVER FELT SOOOO INSULTED IN MY LIFE!!!! 
I told him I wasn't trying to get a free drink...I just know not to EVERRR come to this location AGAIN and I will let everyone aware of this UNPROFESSIONAL MALE MANAGER name KERRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

 BEWARE....THEY MAY ADD DRINKS TO YOUR TAB, THINKING YOU'RE DRUNK!!!!!!

So first I'd like to start out by I went there last night my first time in the bartender yevette was rude I sat there for 10 min waiting for a drink while she sat and talked and counted her tips so my friend and I decided to go for breakfast yevette was there again nasty personality our waitress Samantha made up for it very sweat girl she told me that the chicken fried steak was great when I got it it was so over cooked she did take it off my bill it did have great flavor so I will give it a second chance again Sam was fabulous thanks sam

Food is good but I will not come back here. The bartender is bias to regulars when it comes to Sunday football and what game is broadcast throughout the bar. This is the second weekend when there have been more people watching the Broncos game and 1-2 bar patrons want to hear another game. She changed it or decided to broadcast that gamewithout the consideration of the other patrons. We spent just as much money (over $100) as those bar patrons. Have some consideration for those of us that are NOT gamblers!

Went in tonight after a big win at the casino wanting to celebrate.  The two bartenders didn't seem to care when me and my friends drinks were empty.  I was willing to drop some serious money but concidering I'm not a regular I'm guessing it doesn't matter.  I tipped the food server a 200% tip because she was the only reasonable employee in the place.  I talked to the manager Kerry and he seemed to empathize but did nothing to try to retain my business.  I don't come in every night but when I do am willing to drop at least $100 I guess they don't have to worry because $0 of my money will be spent there.  Worst customer service ever at a local bar.

This is a cool place to hang out with friends. Its a lodge/bar with great food and drinks. Lots of cozy seating. There's a bar side and a restaurant side; but you can order food in the bar too.  It's a great place if you want to have some drinks without the flashiness of the strip.  And it's open 24/7!
This place is very peaceful great food; Great place to eat every single day the best tasty teaser is their name with their burger great business....
We eat here once a week. Service GREAT, Food AMAZING, Value PHENOMENAL. For a wonderful meal with nice atmosphere make sure you visit.

Drinks seem very weak (watered down) hidden pool charges. .such as what do we need to do to play pool? Ask for the ball only to find out after playing several games it's a dollar a game. Ask for redbull vodka here you go. Wait this is not redbull. .. yeah we don't have redbull...WTF!
Jen is the sweetest most attentive bartender.  She made sure I had everything i needed.  And even offered my comped food to go based on my play on the machines.  Mon - Thurs day shift.

This is a good neighborhood bar.  Always sure to run into someone from the Centennial hood up here.  Good food and drink.  Always good service to be had.

As far as additional items of mention in the Las Vegas bar/tavern scene, this place is definitely nicely designed and decorated.  It has restaurant seating for the under 21 crowd and some nice fireside lounge seating in the bar area.  And a few pool tables, which is always fun.

Good spot.

I experienced the worst service ever at this place last night (12/29). There was 6 of us sitting at the bar.  They were not very busy and there was 2 bartenders. We had to wave them down to get refills, food menus and even our bill.  We felt as though we were not welcome because we were not "regulars".  And after last nights service, its highly unlikely that we'll return.

I had the liberty of the GF driving me around while we explored some of the bars in the area.  Having never been to TLAGT, we thought we would stop in an check it out.  The vibe and lay out is similar to another Lodge I have visited. It's kind has an art deco lodgey kind of feel to it.  Similar to what one might feel in the Silverton Hotel and Casino.  Having a quick beer, we did not order any food and found the service to a just A-OK.  I left not really feeling a "hurry back and see us again" feeling.  It is what it is, there are other drinking establishments in area, but I am not hating.

A little smokey for my taste but over all the lodge is a good local option. The food is always good. I love the Colorado chicken wrap. I also love the huge beers and strong drinks. The staff is really nice an most are pretty easy on the eyes.

Some coworkers and I come here every Thursday (it's our Friday so we need a drink or 10). THere's usually about 6-10 of us and the seating area next to the pool tables is our spot. Not too loud but close to the tables and enough room for our group. Had a diff server each time but they've all been great.
Jennifer in the morning is amazing!!! Always a great experience when she is there. Give that girl a raise

Near my house which makes it convenient.  Ok let's be honest it's a good local place that's not going to win any awards but the food is good and not expensive. Jen the daytime bartender is a frantic ball of energy and the reason I go because she remembers you and cares about her customers.  It does appear to me the owners don't care about this location as much as the others..  As I have been to the location in the Southwest and it has been maintained much better.

Decent atmosphere is about all I can say positive about this place haha my boyfriend and I have tried this place twice now....both times we were not impressed I had an iced tea she brought me a coke then tried to tell me I was wrong that it was iced tea.....which annoyed me a bit but whatever when she went to refill my tea she brought out another coke! And tried again to tell me that she knows for sure its not! We sat around for a while and she did the same thing to a table in front of us! It almost seemed like she was doing it on purpose to be funny? I have no idea but I ordered a club nothing tasted fresh I ended up taking off the craft singles they piled on it to make it better the waitress said they had to 're make my food like three times because they kept getting it wrong? It was a turkey club? My boyfriend got a mushroom pasta that ended up being the most unappetizing thing I've ever seen it looked more like soup first off and gave off the most disgusting smell he eats everything but couldn't stomach that.....needless to say we won't be giving that place another shot

My husband had a fly in his beer. And the waitress DID NOT TAKE IT OFF THE BILL. Come on. It took us calling over a manager for anything to get done. We weren't looking for a fully comp'd bill, but a bug in a drink should warrant some compensation. Crazy!

The menu is simple but the food is tasty. The wait staff are very attentive, and they treat their customers well. This place can get really crowded at lunchtime on NFL Sundays, but normally you can get your food pretty quickly.  A nice, clean place to have a good meal and good service - and it's less than a mile away for me. It doesn't get any better than that!
The pastrami Ruben was pretty good especially with tater tots. The beer was slow getting to the table and they could use more craft beers on tap.

I have sat at the bar and had a couple drinks with my husband but I have also met friends for a greasy breakfast here as well (on the non-smoking side). I like that this place has 2 sides with totally different purposes...it can be family friendly or family un-friendly depending on your mood. :)

I've always had great service from the bartender and waitresses. They are fast, friendly and attentive. Couldn't ask for much else!

Eh, it's smokey and sometimes smells like sewer but the food is decent. The bartenders are nice but don't ask for anything special about your order. I've gotten the same salad three times, each time I asked for ranch instead of honey mustard, no luck. I thought maybe third time would be a charm, nope. It's close to the house and like I said the food is decent so we end up there from time to time but there is nothing amazing about this bar. The drinks aren't even cheap.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed The Lodge yet! This is my go to bar for sports since it is right down the street from my house. The beer is always cold and the TVs are always on, and the food is pretty good too. I love coming here for football because they always have drink and food specials. My only gripe is that service is slow since they typically only have 1 bartender, 2 waitresses and a bar back on a typical day I've been here, even on Sunday afternoons when it gets busy! I love Yvette, the bartender who is usually there on Sundays (especially because she's a Cowboys fan too) but being the only bartender on a busy day makes my drink and food orders take a long long time. Another downside is that since it's a gaming bar, people smoke all day at the bar and it makes it a little uncomfortable sometimes when everyone around you is smoking nonstop. If you come here on Mondays for football, they host raffles and giveaways.

I have now been here three times, twice for dinner and once for breakfast. All three times I left disappointed and wishing I had just gone to In-N-Out.  On the most recent visit I tried the nightly special of NY strip with baked potato.  I don't expect a cut rate steak to be cooked to perfection, or even to be that good, but this was one of the worst pieces of beef I have ingested in years.  The midrare steak came out well, well, well done and was not visibly discernible as being a NY strip.  As this was a cut rate steak I kept my complaint between my wife and I, but then when I attempted to take a bite of baked potato (obviously microwaved and not baked) it was as hard as the fork.  When the server came over I tapped my fork against the potato and commented it was barely cooked.  She asked if I wanted another one (really?) and I said yes.  The next micro potato arrived after everything else had been eaten.  One would think the kitchen staff who cut the potato in half would not have served it, but alas they clearly do not care.  

Out of all three trips, I don't think there was any item that was not directly out of a bag, can, mix or otherwise brought in.

A spectacular neighborhood lodge! Family friendly, bar friendly, smoker friendly, sport friendly and they have Billiards. I am not sure that their happy hour is but everything they offer is very reasonably priced. Usually the food service in the dining room is above par. Joy is phenomenal and so sweet!

Definitely a quality establishment and is usually very clean!
The best wings n fries n sandwiches and great staff  The food is always hot and cooked perfect and comes out super fast

Bartender is so indifferent and service is below average. We were gambling, eating and drinking and still struggled to get decent service. Food was good but definitely room for major improvement on the customer service aspect.
Awesome place for happy hour specials. A great place to have a Fat Tire beer and enjoy a game and a visit with an old friend. Will be back
Excellent customer arrive - Linda the waitress is awesome!! Linda makes you feel at home and gives great advice on your selections...

We went here twice in two days. The first day was amazing. Great food, great service, great prices. The second day not so much. Slow service, ok food (partially burnt), and a hair in the fries. Needless to say, we won't be going back for awhile unless I forget about that hair.

Stopped in after work (2:30a) for a night cap and the male bartender acted as though I was bothering him. Was not friendly or professional. I ordered a vodka/pineapple and all I could taste was pineapple. When I informed him of such, he kinda shrugged his shoulders so I asked for a shot of vodka to go with it since it tastes like straight pineapple. He got the vodka shot without saying a word to me, in between doing dishes! He didn't interact with other guests, I'm assuming due to everyone being there with someone... I was solo. Not a lively bartender and I will not be back.

I ate here twice while out on vacation last month.  The service is always good, the food is always excellent, and the drinks are always on.

The bar was always packed here too, I have to say, whether it was ten in the morning or later.  

A great location.  Beautiful scenery.  Prices just about right.

Decent place to watch football games.  They have plenty of big screens and even arm chairs and a seating area to feel like you are at a friends house. I did not understand why they were blasting music during playoff football but maybe I walked in during halftime and they quickly shut off the music when I asked.  The bar has plenty of gaming machines but what I liked is they had a part of the bar with no gaming.  I hate when a place kicks you off a seat at the bar because you are not playing and want to save it for that ONE LOSER that thinks he is gonna hit it big.  

During football games they have some food specials that are not on the menu.  Price points and servings vary depending on how many people you have in your group but they start at $8 and up.  I went for the Beef Sliders and Tater Tot Nachos.  The sliders were filling and a decent snacking size.  The bun was fresh and of good quality.  I thought the Tater Tot dish was an amazing idea and it was surprisingly good in my opinion.  Great little bar food dish.  

Draft beer choices were not great and seemed to be favored towards the Anheuser Busch family of beers. I had a Sierra Nevada and to be honest it did not taste that great, maybe they needed a line flush or its not a beer served often.  

Service was OK and no real issues.  Friendliness and a willingness to be outgoing can go a long way on a bartenders pocket book.  I did not see either of these attributes being displayed during my visit.  However I can be an Asshole at times.

Nice area pub.  I wouldn't bring children hear because of the drinking/bar atmosphere even if they do have a separate dining area.  My husband and I had dinner in the dining area good fast friendly service. The chicken teriyaki lettuce wraps were great- The lettuce seemed like it was just picked fresh. We both enjoyed our dinners and the price.  Lots of items on the menu other than burgers and fries.  We both agreed it would be a nice place to have a drink with friends.

Went here for breakfast. Service was very almost non-existent.  We waited for someone to take our order. Finally the waitress got off her stool at the end of the are and took our order.   The food itself was OK. I had a scramble and it wasn't bad just at the level of a Denny's.  The waitress never returned to fill drinks.  I know this is a bar but I eat breakfast at Timbers and service is always better and prices are better.

The bartender two nights ago sucked and the food was alright. I got some BBQ burger and it was delicious but the meat wasn't seasoned at all. The fries are amazing though. We gambled about $60 and I was the only one who got a drink which was a jack and Coke double. A smart bartender would comp another bartenders drink off for gambling if he wanted a bigger tip, I guess some of us aren't as smart as others.
Love this place!! Food is pretty damn good and it's great place to hangout on a budget! Great staff, my girl Bristina always takes great care of us!!
Love this place. We are regulars. The food is great. Best burgers around and the rib eye was awesome. My favorite is the fish and chips. The servers are friendly and very attentive.
Good bar food from the burgers, salads and breakfast. The food didn't take long and calling in carry out was fast and easy.
This bar is my fave! Good food and draft beers. The bartenders are very attentive and it's a comfy, cozy place. Video poker is hot, I never seem to lose!

Great wings and fries! Service for "outsiders" is not the best. Slow and not very welcoming. Hope to see servers be more attentive and welcoming. A smile goes a long ways too! Would like to come back. I will update my review and hope it goes up to 5 stars.

First off - the sign that says "seat yourself" is so hard to read we had no idea we had to seat ourselves. The restaurant area reeks SO BAD from the smoke from the lounge.. gross.. its 2015 - there are ways to get rid of the smoke smell......

The menu has a lot to choose from - everything is priced reasonably. 

I got the buffalo chicken wrap - great wrap if it didn't have onions in it and had bleu cheese dressing inside. Fries had a great taste!

Boyfriend got the cheeseburger - he said the bun was overcooked.. the burger had zero flavor, could have used seasoning on it.. The cheese looked like it was shredded cheese from a bag, a mixture of colby and jack cheese even though he asked for a slice of cheddar cheese.....

Might be back if we are on a tight budget and want food with eh-okay flavor...

This review is for the meal I had last night. I'm a local and I know the bartenders pretty well and I like the staff. The problem sometimes is it feels more like high school, if you're not in the "in" crowd you're an outsider.
Anyway onto my review. The waitress took my order and she explicitly told the cook I wanted chicken, guess what I got... Steak. So then she apologized and had the cook fix the mistake.. Ok no big deal mistakes happen. But it was brought back with runny eggs and while chewing I felt a sharp pain in my mouth.. Yep a METAL SHARD!!! Presumably from the fryer. So I searched and found another in the potatoes. After all this the manager took a whopping $5 off our meal. I will come here for drinks but I'm done with the food here.. Piss poor

Sitting in the bar, at a table. Took a while for someone to wait on me. The server that did wait on me was extremely slow and forgot some of my order. She was also not friendly at all. I ordered a western burger, it was lacking flavor. Waiting for my check, have no idea where my server went to. 
I will say, I like the way the place looks.

The layout of this place is kind of different. The dining area and the lounge are separated by a glass wall, so I kind of felt like I was eating in a fish bowl.  The physical seperation made the dining area feel rather small. The service was average at best and the food was just average. The lounge looked rather attractive with pool tables, a fireplace with a seating area, a nice bar and plenty of TV's.  The digital sign out front, however, is still advertising a Christmas Party and here it is almost Valentine's Day. There are better places for food in the area, but the lounge put off a lodge vibe and was very unique. I will return to relax in the "lodge".

Both times I have been here my experiences have been less than impressive.  The bartenders are rude and the table service slow....well the bar service slow, too.  This place is definitely not in my neighborhood but I have come here to enjoy drinks with friends who live in this area.  They have told me they are not impressed either but they continue to go because it is close to their house.  I guess if it was close i would probably put up with the mediocre service.  However, i will definitely not make the trip again if i dont have to.  The atmosphere seems nice, its kind of dark and laid back.  I wish the service was more on point though.
Nice bar. Great food. The waitress was on top of her game. I never had to wait for a new shot of Henessey they just kept coming

My boyfriend and I come here when we don't want to go far to get something to eat or make food at home. We always get the Colorado Wrap and it is sooooo tasty. Service is decent nothing absolutely AMAZING but they aren't horrible. They are nice and there when you need them. Prices are good as well. A very home-y atmosphere.
Everytime I see Mike (dark haired with soul patch) I know I'm going to have a blast and great service. Always takes care of me when I'm there no matter how busy.

The Lodge is close to my house, the staff is always very pleasant to deal with and it is a fun place to either have a meal or hang out. 

I have been here a few times, everything that we have had has been good, not outstanding, but good. 

Their machine pay tables are not that great and you have to watch out on the machines blackjack as they will do 100 credits at 5.00 a credit. I found this out after I had won a bit of money, I did get lucky and win it but it was scary for a second.

The Lodge has a nice enough atmosphere with alot of seating, a non-smoking area for eating and pool tables. BUT the drinks are in tiny glasses, full to the top with ice, and the little liquid they put in has barely any alcohol. To top it off they aren't exactly cheap. Oh, and you have to ask the bartender for a refill because they are too busy chatting with other employees or eating. I've only had appetizers and they are ok, but also too expensive for what you get. Too bad they don't get their crap together... could be a really cool place.
We love the lodge at Grand Teton! Great wings, great service!
Really good food, service is hit or miss but nothing terrible. Great neighborhood restaurant.
T he bartender is associated with md13.  I think his name is Andyl. Worst service e ever

Really enjoyed the food at The Lodge.  They have one of the best french onion soups I've ever had...  It's full of flavor and just the right amount of cheese.  

I also had the Chicken Angelo which was delicious.  My wife really enjoyed the Buffalo Chicken Wrap.

We'll definitely be back!

We go to the restaurant section of this place regularly.  The food is always good. However the best part about this place is when we go in and sit down, our waitress comes over with our sodas because she remembers and puts our app order in. She makes us feel like we're her only customer. If you have a chance go by and sit in Jane's section. You won't be disappointed!
Always get the Lodge cheese steak sandwich wich is good but very unconsistent lately, bartenders can be more friendly.

When I got the bill it was a lot more than I respected because they charged me $3 for a 1/4th of a cup of sub-par gravy. She never told me it would be extra and it is just over priced in general. Also the country fried steak was some very poor quality meat. Only good thing about this place was their home fries and decorations. Never going back.

No waitstaff on the floor. Waited and waited but ended up having to go sit at the bar. Even at the bar I waited for quite a while before a sullen bartender came over and asked what I wanted. As the night went on, the other bartender came over a couple of times who was much friendlier. 

Been there several times and service is always iffy and the food is a little below average (although they do serve tater tots!  Yum). It's in a convenient location so I do keep going back but there is room for improvement.
Breakfast is delicious! I haven't been for lunch or dinner but the breakfast is worth going for. Pancakes are so good and service has been quick every time. Will definitely be back.

Went to the Lodge Friday night with a fiend to have a few drinks. We started playing pool having a great time, the waitress that was working the pool area was mia. She brought us one beer and never came back. We decided to eat something before heading out. The dinning room was closed but we were told we could still order food. Same waitress, older lady named April or Amy with long blond hair in a braid. So we are talking just waiting she is looking at us and walking by so finally we asked her if we could order something to eat, she rudely said you can but I'm not going to be your waitress the bartender will be. We ordered a water and ice tea. Waited about 15 more minutes before she came back with our drinks and took our order. Our food took a long time to finally come out. She slams our plates on the table and turns around to leave I stopped her and asked if my toast could be toasted a little bit more (it was like warm bread) she grabs the plate and storms off. So I'm waiting again finally after 20 minutes and no toast I go to the bartender and ask he goes in the back comes back out and says she left for the night. WTF!! He makes me some toast and I refill our drinks. Terrible for food and customer service. That lady needs a new job or some medication!

I came here last night to celebrate a friends birthday.... we order a lot of food (mostly) appetizers, my favorite was the southwest egg rolls with a nice chipotle sauce.  The waitress cassandra cute with braces was an awesome attentive waitress.... She deserved every tip she got and some. My crew can be demanding in a good way and she was right on top..... The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the drinks were watered down. tooooooo much ice. When I go out I don't expect to get drunk but a nice strong buzz is  helpful to enjoy and relax... I had 3 one night stands that taste awesome I am usually done after the 1 or 2nd drink. however it was an great atmosphere and no DRAMA.. yayyy love that dart machine first time really playing darts love it love it

I was with a friend that wanted to go to the lodge and meet up with someone else. she was at the bar, but because i didnt want to drink anymore, i sat in the area woth the couches and Was treated like crap because I dosed off a little. The bartender would not leave me alone no matter how many times I told him I was waiting on someone at the bar. The last straw was him actually using a freaking bull horn. I've spent plenty of money in this bar, but now I will not spend one more dime here. I didn't like this place to begin with, but came all the time with a friend because she likes it. She confronted the bartender and he apologized to her... He never took the time to come apologize to me... I don't recommend wasting your time or money here.
Terrible food. Mediocre drinks. Can't smoke Cigars but cigarettes are OK. What kind of "Lodge" is this?!

This is a regular stop for breakfast. Always get the breakfast sandwiches with bacon and lodge potatoes. It's like I make for myself except they don't make the yolks runny. It's inexpensive and reliably tasty. The coffee is top notch also. That's all I expect in a breakfast place. 5 stars.
The food here is excellent.  Never ate anything bad.  The food is always hit and delicious.  The carrot cake is the bomb and a must try when you are here.   Our server was awesome.

I was worried to come here with my family, but I am glad we tried it. The food was good. The service was excellent! The restaurant was clean with a nice atmosphere. The only drawback for me was having to walk through the lounge to help my child to the bathroom. She was bothered by the smoke. But, we enjoyed French Onion Soup! Also, their pancakes were fluffy and plenteous. Steak & Eggs for $9.99. So enjoy!

Did you used to be a man?!  What I overheard at the bar.  Child present in the bar.  F-bombs flying by staff.  

Drinks with my favorite daughter with entertainment.

We tried this place soon after they opened, which was quite a while ago, and were not impressed. Food wasn't good, and service was just as bad as the food. It was so smoky, it made for a very disagreeable experience. 

Friends of ours talked us into trying it again last Saturday for lunch, and what a difference!

Service was great for our group of 11. The food was excellent, burgers cooked to request and piping hot when served. The smoke on the restaurant side was non-existent, making for a much better dining experience. 

Definitely worth giving them another shot, next time we'll try them for breakfast.
Ordered a chicken fried steak and got chicken. By the time I got my food the rest of my family was done. It only takes a mistake like this to have someone not return.

Came here for my billiards league and found out the food was awesome! Pool tables were crappy and the place is really smokey. 

The reason for the 4 stars is that I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was the best one I've ever had!

Just had a drink there with my son. One thing I will say is if you don't have cancer going in you will going out. They have no air circulation whatsoever and all the knuckleheads at the bar playing video poker are chain smoking like crazy. We had a Modelo and Corona bottle and shockingly the draft was more than the bottle. Who does this? It took 15 minutes from the point where I asked for the check to where she put it on the bar and they actually cashed me out. Avoid this at all cost

My dad wanted hot wings and dragged me here one night with his friend. They have a completely separate area for non smokers and those underage, so I made us sit there instead of at the bar. 
I got the grilled cheese sandwich, pretty cheap with fries AND a side salad for around ten dollars.
The side salad was HUGE, and more of a Cobb salad without meat. It had cucumbers, carrots, onions, olives, and croutons, and I got the raspberry dressing that made it oh so good.
The grilled cheese wasn't great. It was made with kraft singles and regular white bread, but hey, it's a bar, I don't expect amazing food. The fries were good, and my dad liked his wings well enough.

Our first visit to The Lodge @ Grand Teton. There was only one waiter and she was busy. The ambiance was very nice,quite chatter not too noisy. The orange juice had an after taste that i did not care for. I had the Denver omelet which was cool upon arrival,the house fried potatoes was unevenly cooked some soft,some hard, The cheese on top of the omelet was microwaved, I ordered Whole Wheat toast and received Sourdough. The coffee was very good, i was offered a refill,but never received it. My wife ordered potatoes,Bacon,eggs (over medium) and toast, Bacon was not crispy and eggs was over easy at best. We both ordered a pre-meal glass of water which never came. We left a "we were not satisfied" tip of 3.00 only because the waitress was busy before getting some help. This was on a Wednesday morning,maybe this explains somethings.

Recently moved to the neighborhood and tried the place out for the first time. Food and service were great. Second and third times were the complete opposite when it came to the service. The bartenders did the normal local bar routine which is acknowledge and cater to the people that you know and see almost on a daily basis and leave the unknown and potential new guests to wonder if anyone is going to even acknowledge them. I notice the 2 bartenders that were working this evening seem to have thier pick of where they spend the most of thier time. The lady bartender tended to stay at the entrance of  the bar were a group of people that she obviously knew sat. The guy was more interested and flirtatious with a couple of ladies that came in. I attempted to get both bartenders attention several times to get service. The only person that seemed pleasant  on all occassions was the waitress that was not actually working behind the bar but serving the rest of the floor. I am not an outspoken person as i can very well go elsewhere rather than spend my money to get the service that I've received on the last 2 visits to this location.

Dont come here looking for service unless you game! Only one that really attended us was Megan! Get em Megan! The bartender sucked and waved at me when i tryes to call her over, anyways this spot seemed nice but as far as service went to get a drink it was a loss. If you are a gamer god ahead waste your money and get crap service! Food was meh... Im a firm believer in the relativity in looking for service and looking for yer tip! Get Em Megan!

I am updating my last review from a couple of years ago. We went with a huge party, 18 people, for dinner. I did not eat, but my family did and I saw the food and their reaction to it. Everyone seemed to like the food well enough and the prices were fair. I would not go out of my way to eat here, but if you do, you will probably leave relatively satisfied.

This place is the worst,my girlfriend ordered the chopped salad and it was just a bowl of lettuce we complained and they said it would be extra for the ingredients that already should be in the salad they can't even pour an ice tea right it tasted like it was mixed w/ soda overpriced and nasty dirty food beware!!

WORST SERVICE EVER!!! Female bar tender snotty and rude.  Hispanic waiter the worse too. Never checked on us and we had to yell HELLO really loud to get bartenders attention.  

Food was good. French fries great!

Don't go to this dump, went in had breakfast, because a friend was there, already figured my $$ was gone before I put it in these horrible machines, in the past I've never one dime, and they usually try to charge you for a beer or two, even though you've blown a couple hundred dollars, but today topped it off, I ordered the French toast(which was good by the way) gambled $60, and they charged me for my milk, I'm surprised they didn't charge me for my water as well, I'm never stepping foot in this crap hole again. WORST BAR IN VEGAS
food ok, service was good..beer was cold.pool tables were good . enjoyed the night with my son.
